Legal_Issue: Can the Registrar's decision to publish official marks by the Canadian Olympic Committee (COC) be quashed due to lack of adoption and use?
Evidence_Assessment: The COC provided minimal evidence of adoption and use, relying on unsworn statements. The Registrar failed to investigate despite prior trademark applications by SYI Fund using similar marks.
Burden_of_Proof: On the COC to demonstrate adoption and use of the official mark
Credibility_Factor: Unsworn statements provided by COC lacked sufficient credibility
Legal_Rule: Section 9(1)(n)(iii) prohibits adoption of any mark used as an official mark by a public authority without proper adoption and use
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness in judicial review of administrative decisions
Procedural_Issue: Registrar failed to conduct adequate investigation into adoption and use before publishing the official mark
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of sufficient evidence of adoption and use by COC
Outcome_on_Merits: SYI Fund’s challenge succeeds on merits due to insufficient proof by COC
Review_Standard: Judicial review of administrative decision under the Trade-marks Act
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Registrar did not fulfill duty of inquiry, raising procedural fairness concerns
Key_Evidence_Considered: Unsworn statements from COC, prior trademark applications by SYI Fund
Legal_Framework: Trade-marks Act, Canadian administrative law principles
Applicant_Challenge: SYI Fund challenged the Registrar’s decision to allow COC’s official mark
Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory: Section 9(1)(n)(iii) of the Trade-marks Act
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for adoption and use of official mark
Defendant_Response: COC asserted use as an official mark but failed to provide sufficient evidentiary support
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, unsworn declarations, prior trademark filings
Outcome: Registrar’s decision quashed; COC cannot claim official mark status without proper adoption and use
Decision_Authority: Federal Court (implied by judicial review context)
Remedy_Sought: Invalidation of the official mark designation
Authority: Canadian Olympic Committee (COC) as public authority claiming official mark
Claimant_Status: SYI Fund as challenger of the official mark
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of adoption and use of the mark by COC
Applicable_Process: Administrative process under the Trade-marks Act followed by judicial review
Jurisdiction: Canada, Federal jurisdiction under the Trade-marks Act
